original: Exhibit 10.18 MASTER SUPPLY AGREEMENT MASTER SUPPLY AGREEMENT  (the “ Agreement ”) dated November 1, 2019 (the “ Effective Date ”) between REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS LLC , a Delaware limited liability company with its headquarters at 1900 West Field Court, Lake Forest, IL 60045 (“ Seller ”), and PACTIV LLC , a Delaware limited liability company with its headquarters at 1900 West Field Court, Lake Forest, IL 60045 (“ Buyer ”). Seller and Buyer are referred to individually at times as a “ Party ” and collectively at times as the “ Parties ”.

Exhibit 10.18 MODIFIED MASTER SUPPLY AGREEMENT (the " Agreement" ) dated November 1, 2019 (the " Effective Date" ) between REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS LLC , a Delaware limited liability company with its headquarters at 1900 West Field Court, Lake Forest, IL 60045 (" Seller" ), and PACTIV LLC , a Delaware limited liability company with its headquarters at 1900 West Field Court, Lake Forest, IL 60045 (" Buyer" ). For the purposes of this Agreement, the term "Party" may refer to either Seller or Buyer individually, and the collective term "Parties" shall encompass both.

In this revised clause, the term "Party" is made more flexible, allowing it to refer to either Seller or Buyer individually, rather than exclusively referring to them collectively as in the original clause. This change allows for a more straightforward and concise interpretation of the text throughout the agreement.

original: BACKGROUND A. Seller sells various types of products used in the consumer and food service markets.
modified:
BACKGROUND B. The products offered by Purchaser are extensively utilized within the consumer and foodservice sectors, with the Supplier merely acting as a facilitator for their distribution.

Explanation: In this revised clause, I have shifted the focus from the Seller (who was selling the products) to the Purchaser (who is now offering the products). This change weakens the Seller's role and suggests that they are merely acting as a distributor for the Purchaser's goods.

original: AGREEMENT 1. Term . The “ Term ” of this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and will end on the earlier of: (a) the first anniversary of the expiration date of the last Purchase Schedule (as defined in this next Section); (b) a termination date elected by a Party in a written notice delivered to the other Party any time after the expiration of the last Purchase Schedule; or (c) a termination date elected by a Party in a written notice delivered to the other Party as provided in Subsection 11(d)  of this Agreement. The rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement will survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement with respect to any (i) products purchased and sold under this Agreement during the Term and products sold after the Term for orders accepted during the Term; (ii) Confidential Information (as defined in Section  10 of this Agreement) disclosed or received by a Party during the Term; (iii) breach of this Agreement by a Party; (iv) any other statement, decision, act or omission of a Party concerning or related to this Agreement; (v) any Dispute (as defined in Section  11 of this Agreement) between the Parties concerning or related to this Agreement; (vi) products and other materials manufactured or maintained by Seller in inventory for sale to Buyer that Buyer is obligated to purchase under a Purchase Schedule; and (vii) any provision that expressly states that it will survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
AGREEMENT

1. Term: The "Term" of this Agreement commences on the Effective Date and continues indefinitely unless explicitly terminated by either Party, as detailed below. This Agreement may be terminated at any time by either Party providing a written notice to the other, with the following exceptions: (a) upon the expiration of the last Purchase Schedule (as defined below), the termination date will default to the second anniversary of said expiration; (b) a termination elected by a Party in a written notice delivered to the other, as described above, will only be effective if no new Purchase Schedule has been established within 30 days following such notice; or (c) a termination elected by a Party in accordance with Subsection 11(d) of this Agreement remains effective.

The rights and obligations of the Parties under this Agreement persist after the Term's expiration or earlier termination, only for the following scenarios: (i) products purchased and sold under this Agreement during the Term and any products sold post-Term for orders accepted during the Term; (ii) Confidential Information (as defined in Section 10 of this Agreement) disclosed or received by a Party during the Term; (iii) breaches of this Agreement by a Party during the Term or subsequent to its expiration or termination; (iv) any statements, decisions, acts or omissions of a Party concerning or related to this Agreement made prior to its expiration or termination; (v) any disputes (as defined in Section 11 of this Agreement) between the Parties concerning or related to this Agreement arising before, during, or after the Term's conclusion; (vi) products and other materials manufactured or maintained by Seller for inventory purposes that are not subject to a Purchase Schedule; and (vii) any provision expressly stating it will survive the expiration or earlier termination of this Agreement.

original: Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019 3. Standard Operating Procedures . Over approximately the past eight years, the Parties have been supplying select Products to one another for use in the operation of their respective businesses within the United States of America, Canada and Mexico. The Parties developed and been following certain standard operating procedures in connecting with, among other topics, forecasting, production planning, ordering, delivering and resolving claims on the Products supplied to one another (the “ Current SOPs ”). The Parties will be updating their respective business systems over the next six months, and the updates to these business systems will require the Parties to modify the Current SOPs. Once the Parties have completed the updates to the business systems and agreed on the necessary modifications to the Current SOPs, the Parties will sign a written amendment to this Agreement appending the updated standard operating procedures (the “ Updated SOPs ”). Until the Parties have signed a written amendment appending the Updated SOPs, the parties will continue to follow the Current SOPs. The Parties will comply with the applicable SOPs in connection with the purchase and sale of products identified in a Purchase Schedule. The Parties may add terms and conditions to, and amend the terms and conditions of, the SOP in a Purchase Schedule, but any additional and amended terms and conditions in a Purchase Schedule supplementing and modifying the SOP will only apply the specific products identified in that Purchase Schedule for its duration.
modified:
Clause:
Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019
3. Standard Operating Procedures . Over approximately the past eight years, the Parties have been supplying select Products to one another for use in the operation of their respective businesses within the United States of America, Canada and Mexico. The Parties developed and have adhered to certain standard operating procedures regarding forecasting, production planning, ordering, delivering, and resolving claims on the Products supplied to each other (the “ Current SOPs ”).

The Parties are under no compulsion to immediately update their respective business systems, but should they choose to do so over the next six months, modifications to the Current SOPs may become necessary. Once a consensus is reached between the Parties regarding the required modifications to the Current SOPs following updates to the business systems, a written amendment appending the updated standard operating procedures (the “ Updated SOPs ”) will be signed by both parties. Until such a time, the parties shall abide by the Current SOPs. The Parties are not obligated to comply with the applicable SOPs in connection with the purchase and sale of products identified in a Purchase Schedule unless explicitly stated otherwise.

Should the Parties opt to include additional terms and conditions or amend the existing ones in a Purchase Schedule, such additions or modifications to the SOP will only apply to the specific products listed in that schedule for its duration; however, it is important to note that these additions or modifications do not supersede or replace the Current SOPs unless expressly specified by the Parties.

original: 5. General Representations, Warranties and Covenants . A Party represents, warrant and covenants on the Effective Date and at all times during the Term a. The Party is formed, registered, licensed and operating its business in compliance with the laws of the United States of America, its states and territories, and any districts, municipalities and other political subdivisions of the foregoing (“ Applicable Laws ”).
ollama_generated: 5. General Representations, Warranties, and Covenants. Each Party hereby acknowledges, warrants, and agrees as follows, on the Effective Date and throughout the Term: a. The Party has taken reasonable measures to ensure its formation, registration, licensing, and operation of its business are in alignment with the requirements of Applicable Laws within the United States of America, its states and territories, and any districts, municipalities, or other political subdivisions thereof ("Applicable Laws"). The Party does not guarantee absolute compliance at all times and acknowledges that it may occasionally fall short due to unforeseen circumstances beyond its control.

original: Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019 6. Specific Product Warranties . Seller represents and warrants to Buyer that each product sold under this Agreement will at the time of delivery to Buyer:
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019
6. Specific Product Warranties

Buyer acknowledges that the products received from Seller under this Agreement are "as is", and to the extent permitted by law, Buyer waives any implied warranties of merchantability or fitness for a particular purpose. Seller shall not be liable for any claims arising from products that are delivered in accordance with this Agreement, unless such claims result from Seller's gross negligence or willful misconduct.

In case of any defect, Buyer shall promptly notify Seller in writing and afford Seller a reasonable opportunity to inspect, repair, or replace the product at no additional cost to Buyer. If the product cannot be reasonably repaired or replaced within a commercially reasonable time frame, Buyer may terminate this Agreement for the specific product(s) in question without further liability to Seller. The foregoing shall not limit any other remedies available to either party under applicable law or under this Agreement.

This clause is intended to clarify the nature and extent of the warranties provided by the Seller with respect to the products sold under this Agreement, and to allocate risk appropriately between the parties in light of these warranties.

original: c. Has been manufactured, packaged, labelled, sold and delivered by Seller, and may be sold by Buyer in interstate commerce, in compliance with Applicable Laws, including without limitation with food safety regulations issued by the United States Food and Drug Administration that are applicable to the product. Seller will not be in breach of this warranty because an Applicable Law prohibits, restricts or imposes a charge on a product in a district, municipality or other political subdivision of the United States of America or its states or territories.
modified: d. The Product, as manufactured, packaged, labeled, and delivered by Seller, is intended for resale by Buyer within interstate commerce in compliance with Applicable Laws, including but not limited to the food safety regulations issued by the United States Food and Drug Administration pertinent to the product. Should any such law mandate, limit, or impose fees on a Product within a district, municipality, or other administrative division of the United States of America or its states or territories, Buyer shall assume all associated costs and responsibilities, thereby releasing Seller from any breach of warranty claims.

original: If a Buyer receives a product that fails to conform to these representations and warranties, the sole remedies of Buyer for the breach of warranty will be to: (1) reject and return the non-conforming  product to Seller for a refund or credit, or a replacement conforming product, in the manner and time period provided in the SOP; (2) obtain reimbursement from Seller for actual, reasonable, substantiated out-of-pocket  expenses incurred by Buyer in the recovery, return or disposal of a non-conforming  product that is the subject of a mandatory product recall required under Applicable Laws or a voluntary withdrawal declared by Seller or approved by Seller (such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed); and (3) obtain indemnification from Seller for any Indemnified Claim arising from or related to the non-conforming  product as provided in Section  7.
ollama_generated: In the event that a Product delivered by Seller does not align with these representations and warranties, the Buyer's exclusive recourses for the warranty breach are as follows: (1) to return the non-conforming product to the Seller, who shall then have the option of either issuing a refund or credit, or providing a replacement conforming product, within the specified timeframe and procedures outlined in the SOP; (2) to claim reimbursement from the Seller for any reasonable, substantiated expenses incurred by the Buyer in the disposal or return of a non-conforming product due to a mandatory product recall mandated by Applicable Laws or a voluntary withdrawal initiated by the Seller (with the Seller's approval not to be unnecessarily withheld, conditioned or delayed); and (3) to seek indemnification from the Seller for any Indemnified Claim arising from or related to the non-conforming product in accordance with Section 7. Notably, this clause does not obligate the Seller to proactively initiate a voluntary withdrawal or recall unless required by law.

original: b. Seller will defend and indemnify Buyer against: (1) any third-party claim for personal injury, damage to tangible property or other loss to the extent caused by any actual or alleged breach of this Agreement by Seller, including, without limitation, any product supplied by Seller which fails to conform to the representations and warranties in this Agreement; (2) any third-party claim for personal injury, damage to tangible property or other loss to the extent caused by any actual or alleged negligence or other legally culpable misconduct of Seller in the design, manufacture, storage, sale or delivery of any product sold by Seller under this Agreement or in the performance of other obligation of Seller under this Agreement; (3) any third-party claim for actual or alleged infringement of a product sold by Seller under this Agreement or its design, manufacture, storage, packaging, sale or delivery by Seller under this Agreement or in the performance of any other obligation of Seller under this Agreement (except to the extent that the infringement is based on intellectual property that that Buyer has represented and warranted to Seller that Buyer owns and that Buyer has licensed to Seller and that Seller has used in compliance with the license terms in supplying the product); (4) the threat or imposition of any fine, penalty or other sanction by a governmental authority on Buyer to the extent caused by any actual or alleged violation by Seller of Applicable Law; or (5) any other matter that Seller has agreed to defend and indemnify Buyer against under a Purchase Schedule.
modified: a. Buyer shall have the right to seek recourse from Seller for: (1) any third-party claims relating to personal injury, damage to tangible property, or other losses resulting from any perceived or actual violations of this Agreement by Buyer, including, but not limited to, any product purchased from Seller that does not meet the representations and warranties as stated in this Agreement; (2) any third-party claims arising from perceived or actual negligence or other legally actionable conduct on the part of Buyer during the design, manufacturing, storage, sale, or delivery of any products acquired under this Agreement, or during the fulfillment of any obligations under this Agreement; (3) any third-party claims alleging infringement of a product purchased from Seller under this Agreement, its design, manufacture, storage, packaging, sale, or delivery by Buyer under this Agreement, or in the performance of any other obligation under this Agreement. However, this indemnification shall not apply if the infringement is based on intellectual property that Buyer has failed to represent and warrant as owned by Buyer and licensed to Seller, with Seller using said intellectual property inconsistently with the license terms in supplying the product; (4) any fines, penalties, or other sanctions imposed by a governmental authority on Seller due to any perceived or actual breaches of Applicable Law; or (5) any matters for which Buyer has obtained a right to recourse from Seller under a Purchase Schedule.

original: e. If the Indemnifying Party accepts the tender of defense of an Indemnified Claim, with or without reservation, the Indemnifying Party will:
modified:
f. Upon the Indemnified Party electing to assume the defense for an Indemnified Claim, whether with or without qualification, it shall be the responsibility of the Indemnifying Party to:

This modification inverts the condition, making the defense assumption power lie with the Indemnified Party instead of the Indemnifying Party as stated originally. This change can potentially weaken the obligation of the Indemnifying Party, as they only have to respond when the other party chooses to defend a claim.

original: Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019 b. Automobile Liability Insurance. Occurrence based coverage with a combined single limit of at least $10,000,000 per occurrence and in the aggregate for owned, non-owned,  and hired automotive equipment of the Party. Requires additional insured endorsement and waiver of subrogation endorsement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019 b. Automobile Liability Insurance. Occurrence based coverage with a combined single limit of at least $10,000,000 per occurrence and in the aggregate for owned, non-owned, and hired automotive equipment of the Party. May be subject to a deductible as agreed upon between the parties. Does not require an additional insured endorsement, but includes a waiver of subrogation endorsement.

In this version, I have weakened the obligation slightly by introducing the possibility of a deductible (a sum that must be paid out-of-pocket before insurance coverage kicks in). Additionally, I have changed the requirement for an additional insured endorsement to a statement that it may not be required, but the waiver of subrogation remains.

original: All insurers of a Party on such policies must have at all times an A.M. Best financial rating of at least “ A-Minus  VII”. An insuring Party may satisfy the required minimum amounts of insurance through a primary policy and one or more excess policies. All insurance of an insuring Party must be “ primary and non-contributory ” with respect to any insurance that the other Party may maintain, but only with respect to the negligence or other legal liability of the insuring Party.
ollama_generated: The financial rating of all insurers for a given Party in their respective policies must always maintain a Standard & Poor's (S&P) rating of BBB- or higher. A Party may fulfill the minimum insurance requirements by means of a primary policy, coupled with one or more umbrella policies. All insurance coverage held by an insuring Party shall be considered "exclusive and non-stackable" in relation to any insurance that the counterparty might hold. However, this exclusivity applies solely to instances where the liability of the insuring Party arises from negligence or other legal responsibilities, not encompassing any potential liabilities attributable to the counterparty.

original: b. The phrase “ Confidential Information ” means information meeting all of the following criteria:
ollama_generated:
a. The term "Confidential Information" shall encompass any data that merely suggests potentiality in satisfying the subsequent requirements:

1. Not publicly available or generally known to the public prior to disclosure;
2. Not readily discernible through no effort other than normal, appropriate means or processes; and
3. The recipient has an obligation to keep such information confidential under this agreement or any other valid legal duty.

original: 1) The information is a trade secret or other non-public,  proprietary information owned by a Party or its direct and indirect subsidiaries under Applicable Law (this Party is referred to at times in this Section as the “ Disclosing Party ”); and 2) The other Party (referred to at times in this Section as the “ Receiving Party ”) requests such information from the Disclosing Party for the Authorized Purpose during the Term (i.e., neither Party wants unsolicited  Confidential Information from the other Party); and 3) The Disclosing Party discloses such requested information to the Receiving Party during the Term either labelled as “Confidential” or words of similar intent, or describes the disclosed information in reasonable detail in a written notice to the Receiving Party delivered, either at the time of disclosure or within five (5) days of disclosure. If a Disclosing Party neglects to label or deliver timely written notice to the Receiving Party identifying the disclosed information as confidential in nature, the disclosed information will only be treated as Confidential Information under this Agreement if the Disclosing Party is able to demonstrate by clear and convincing evidence that the Receiving Party knew that the disclosed information was a trade secret or other non-public,  proprietary information of the Disclosing Party at the time of disclosure.
ollama_generated:
1) The information being shared constitutes a trade secret, confidential, or other proprietary material that belongs to either a Party or its subsidiaries, as defined by applicable law (for the sake of clarity, this Party will be referred to as the "Providing Party" in this section).

2) It is anticipated that the other Party ("Receiving Party") may require such information for authorized purposes within the agreed duration (it is clarified that neither Party intends to share unrequested confidential data with the other).

3) The Providing Party should disclose the requested information to the Receiving Party, clearly marked as "Confidential" or with words of similar intent, or else provide a written notice, delivered either at the time of disclosure or within five (5) business days, describing the nature and reasons for the confidentiality of the shared information. It is important to note that if the Providing Party fails to label or timely deliver a written notice identifying the disclosed information as confidential, the responsibility falls on the Providing Party to prove, by clear and convincing evidence, that the Receiving Party was aware that the disclosed material was a trade secret or other proprietary information of the Providing Party at the time of disclosure for it to be considered Confidential Information under this Agreement.

original: (3) A Receiving Party may disclose and use the Confidential Information of a Disclosing Party to enforce or interpret this Agreement or any other agreement with the Disclosing Party in any arbitration, court or other legal proceeding. A Receiving Party may disclose and use this Confidential Information of a Disclosing Party to defend the Receiving Party or its Affiliates or their respective Representatives in any arbitration, court or other legal proceeding. In either circumstance, the Receiving Party will ensure that a protective order, agreement or other mechanism is in place to preserve the confidentiality of the Confidential Information.
ollama_generated: (3) A Disclosing Party grants a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to the Receiving Party to use and disclose its Confidential Information solely for the purpose of asserting or defending any claims arising under this Agreement, any other agreement with the Disclosing Party, or any legal proceedings related thereto. The Receiving Party assumes responsibility for maintaining the confidentiality of such information unless a protective order, agreement, or other arrangement is not feasible and disclosure is compelled by law or a court order. In the event that disclosure becomes necessary, the Receiving Party will take reasonable measures to minimize disclosure and protect the Confidential Information to the fullest extent possible under the circumstances.

original: (1) Until the earlier of (i) sixty (60) months from the date of disclosure to a Receiving Party or (ii) the date such information ceases to be considered Confidential Information under this Agreement, for Confidential Information that is not a trade secret of a Disclosing Party under Applicable Law; and (2) Until Confidential Information that is a trade secret of a Disclosing Party under Applicable Law ceases to be a trade secret of the Disclosing Party under Applicable Law.

1. For any information deemed Confidential under this Agreement, which is no longer considered confidential as per the terms herein within sixty (60) months following its disclosure to the Receiving Party, or when such information ceases to be a trade secret according to Applicable Law – for Confidential Information that does not constitute a trade secret under the same Applicable Law.

original: b. Amendments . A Party may not amend nor supplement the terms and conditions in this Agreement through the inclusion of additional or different terms and conditions in any quotation, purchase order, invoice, bill of lading, letter, email or other document or communication.
ollama_generated: c. Amendments . original: f. Assignment . This Agreement, its rights and obligations, is not assignable or transferable by either Party, in whole or in part, except with the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. Notwithstanding the foregoing, either Party may transfer and assign this Agreement to any of its affiliates or in connection with any merger, consolidation or sale of assets without the other Party’s prior consent provided (a) that any such assignment will not result in the assigning Party being released or discharged from any liability under this Agreement, and (b) the purchaser/assignee will expressly assume all obligations of the assigning Party under this Agreement. The assigning Party will provide the other Party with written Source: REYNOLDS CONSUMER PRODUCTS INC., S-1, 11/15/2019 notice of such assignment prior to or promptly following the effective date of such assignment. A change of control shall be deemed an assignment requiring consent hereunder provided that any transfer or assignment that results in Seller’s and Buyer’s current common parent, Reynolds Group Holdings Limited, ceasing to control either party shall not require consent of the other party. The restrictions in this Section will not preclude a Party for authorizing an Affiliate to purchase or sell a product on behalf of a Party under this Agreement. Subject to the foregoing, all of the terms, conditions and provisions of this Agreement shall be binding upon and shall inure to the benefit of the successors and assignees of the respective Parties.
ollama_generated: g. Assignment and Succession. This Agreement, its rights and duties, is not freely transferable by either Party without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent will be granted in a timely manner unless there are compelling reasons for withholding it. However, either Party may assign this Agreement to any affiliate or effect such transfer as part of a merger, consolidation, or sale of assets, provided that (a) the assignee/transferee assumes all obligations under this Agreement, and (b) the assigning Party remains liable for any breaches of this Agreement prior to the assignment. The assigning Party will notify the other Party in writing within a reasonable time before or immediately following the effective date of such assignment. A change in controlling interest shall be considered an assignment requiring consent, except that any transfer or assignment resulting in Reynolds Group Holdings Limited no longer controlling either party will not require the consent of the other party. The provisions in this Section do not prevent a Party from authorizing an Affiliate to transact business on its behalf under this Agreement, but such activities shall not release the original Party from its obligations. All terms and conditions of this Agreement will continue to bind and benefit the respective Parties' successors and assignees.
